Traveled to Barcelona in March, 2012. I am not exaggerating when I say this is the best restaurant in all of Spain!  Yes, we also found this spot thanks to a guide book.  What a wonderful surprise.  I was soo impressed i immediately wanted to e-mail the author and say "Thank You"!  This place embodies everything I imagined a Spanish restaurant would be!  I have been to many fine dining destinations and seriously this place rivals all of them.  Location: Exterior -hidden and charming / Interior -rustic and chic (background music was super cool- jazz to classical pieces)Food:    We ordered the "Menu - Servit a la Barra which consisted of roasted chicken in  a harvest fruit sauce and potato puree, prefaced by an escarole bacon salad and finished with a lovely apple tartine.  We were also served this beautiful (seriously) and delicious medley of rustic breads and olives.  Their house wine was also solidly good.  Remember to have a carajillo to finish off your meal.Service - Warm, welcoming, friendly.  We loved our waitress!  We initially sat at the bar because it was less expensive.  However, we would have paid full price anyway  to sit and chat with the servers.  Do not pass up this place.  It epitomizes Spain in all of it's splendor.
